page.title: 09Preston Green
page.content: Preston Green is a small commuter hamlet. Almost all of the houses are large and expensive. There are no local facilities, no school, no shops, not even a telephone box. In fact the only thing we saw was a post box. Local industry is farming - mixed arable and grazing. This supports only a few families who live in the few farms and farm cottages. Otherwise there is only a family nursery garden and a Bed and Breakfast hotel both situated on the main road ( B4095 ) to take advantage of passing trade. Residents obviously travel to Warwick, Leamington, Stratford and perhaps even Birmingham, both to work and for shopping and for other requirements.
